SEARCH
Package views

Interface BSTViewInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
BSTView
public interface BSTViewInterface
Interface for the View component in the MVC design pattern for a Binary Search Tree (BST) visualization. It extends both ActionListener and KeyListener, meaning the view can handle button actions and keyboard events.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    JButton
    getAddButton()
    Gets the "Add" button for inserting nodes into the BST.
    JButton
    getDeleteButton()
    Gets the "Delete" button for removing nodes from the BST.
    JTextField
    getInputField()
    Gets the input field for entering values to add or delete in the BST.
    void

    Sets the controller for the View.
    void
    updateTraversal(String inorder, String preorder, String postorder)
    Updates the traversal panel to display the results of tree traversals.
    void

    Updates the tree panel to reflect the new tree structure.

  • Method Details

    • setController

      void setController(BSTController controller)
      Sets the controller for the View. This establishes communication between the View and the Controller in the MVC architecture.
      Parameters:
      controller - The BSTController instance to control the tree's operations.

    • updateTreePanel

      void updateTreePanel(Node root)
      Updates the tree panel to reflect the new tree structure. This method is called when the tree structure changes and needs to be redrawn.
      Parameters:
      root - The root node of the updated tree.

    • updateTraversal

      void updateTraversal(String inorder, String preorder, String postorder)
      Updates the traversal panel to display the results of tree traversals. This is used to show the outputs of inorder, preorder, and postorder traversals.
      Parameters:
      inorder - The result of the inorder traversal.
      preorder - The result of the preorder traversal.
      postorder - The result of the postorder traversal.

    • getAddButton

      JButton getAddButton()
      Gets the "Add" button for inserting nodes into the BST. This provides a reference to the button for adding functionality or event handling.
      Returns:
      The "Add" button object.

    • getDeleteButton

      JButton getDeleteButton()
      Gets the "Delete" button for removing nodes from the BST. This provides a reference to the button for deleting functionality or event handling.
      Returns:
      The "Delete" button object.

    • getInputField

      JTextField getInputField()
      Gets the input field for entering values to add or delete in the BST. This provides access to the text field where users can input values.
      Returns:
      The input field object.
